intro: Echinospermum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican echinospermum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Echinospermum mexicanum is often found in rocky soils and can be used in traditional herbal medicine.
